body.p:
Nicholasville. Ky. August 14th 1865.
His Excellency. Thomas. E. Bramlette.
Governor. Of. Kentucky.
Sir.

Your petitioners respectfully state that at the march term of the Jessamine Circuit Court. Joseph Chrisman, John. H. Scott, George Lowen and Chilton Lowen were indicted severally for stealing horses. Now whereas your excellency has already pardoned Joseph Chrisman and John H Scott. before conviction we respectfully petition, and ask for your pardon in the case of George Lowen and Chilton Lowen. They are the sons of a poor man and it is believed that if the executive clemency be extended to them, that the past will be a warning and in the future the future their conduct will be that of good citizens.

Yours. Respectfully.
W. Brown.
John A Willis Clerk Jessamine County Ct --
S. Noland clk Jessa Cir ct
J. S. Brouaugh Co atty for Jessamine Co.
Jas H M Campbell
Foreman Grand Jury
N Dickerson S. J. C
George Lowens Indicted for stealing one hog March 6th 1865 of Charlotte Paget.
George Lowens Indicted for stealing one ^gray^ horse March 6th 1865 of James B Davis
Chilton Lowens indicted for stealing ^and^ receiving a bay mare the property of Moroney Moore knowing the same had been stolen. March 6th 1865

Jessamine Cir Ct
vs
George & Chilton Lowen
Pardoned
